greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Length of the largest left-truncatable prime (in base n).
comment: The next term (base 30) will be difficult to calculate because there are over a trillion left-truncatable primes in that base for each of digit-lengths 29-34. Nevertheless, the largest left-truncatable prime in this base can be estimated by theory to have a length of about 82. [Hans Havermann, Aug 16 2011]
link: I. O. Angell and H. J. Godwin, On Truncatable Primes, Math. Comput. 31, 265-267, 1977.
Index entries for sequences related to truncatable primes
results.author: _Martin Renner_, Mar 21 2005, Feb 20 2008, Apr 20 2008
